TopicTitle: Help me put the rocket builders in the wayback machine! [I NEED YOUR HELP!] [NEW HOME]

Articles.Content:
I've seen some threads trying to change squad's mind about the rocket builders, but, in case those don't work, we must back up the forum!

[SIZE=4][B]This is the moved version, please post only here from now on.[/B][/SIZE]

[quote name='Vanamonde']This sounds like a job for... [I]The Rocket Builders! [/I](Queue theme music...)[/QUOTE]


I will keep a list of all pages on the forum done.

If you choose to back up a page, you must back up ALL threads and posts in them. Or you can back up an individual thread, or even a thread only to extent.

Remember to update pages with older archives, what page 21 looked like in 2013 might be different now.

The incredible Thomas P. has made a python script to automate the process, which makes it much faster:
[quote name='Thomas P.']Hi guys,

I don't really want to support all the crap that came up in RocketBuilders in the last days, but since you are the only thread with an actual solution for the problem (or rather, a workaround), I decided to give you some help. But not in form of actual submissions to archive.org, but instead of a script (Python) to uplaod an entire thread to the Wayback machine. All you have to do is to run the script and to enter the id of the thread you want to upload. Then you have to wait some time while the script calls the WaybackMachine for every page that is in that thread.

Grab the script here: [URL]https://gist.github.com/ThomasKerman/0a0b810422d5972fe5f2[/URL]
All you need is the Python 2.7 runtime environment: [URL]https://www.python.org/downloads/[/URL]
If you have theese two components open a CMP / Powershell in the path of the script and run python <scriptname>.py

~Thomas[/QUOTE]

Please don't make this another attack against the Rocket Builders.

[quote name='SpaceplaneAddict']Please don't make this another attack against the Rocket Builders.[/QUOTE]

Not an attack against the rocket builders. My attitude is that they can be removed, and we won't be much worse off. Your attitude is that if they're removed, we'll be at a great disservice. The highest-ups' attitude is that they violate the rules. Edited November 27, 2015 by Tangle

I just wish I could have done more. Unfortunately, I was busy with family for the past few days.

On November 26, 2015 at 21:15:02, Tangle said:

Not an attack against the rocket builders. My attitude is that they can be removed, and we won't be much worse off. Your attitude is that if they're removed, we'll be at a great disservice. The highest-ups' attitude is that they violate the rules.

This may be true but a lot of people share both attitudes. The majority of those that share your attitude have/will ignore this thread and move on. Which, in my opinion, is what you should have done. Your comment adds nothing to this thread and could be seen as trolling by some.

Edited December 1, 2015 by ExplorerKlatt

Ooof, it's a sad day for us.  The forum upgrade saves the rocket builders... but only your personal threads on it.  That means that we need everyone to ever post in the rocket builders to help to get them archived.  It is unlikely that we will get everything in the rocket builders archived.  However, I still need people's help!  Please, if you've ever posted in the rocket builders, archive everything you see in there!

https://web.archive.org/web/20151126034506/http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71013-KIP-Inc?highlight=KIP

 

My post emerges from the Vault!
